ovdesc.p: This application, as the name implies, is used to group together category codes for use within the MI module. This is done at a higher level to simplify MI.SELECTION records. For example ;
52100 Mailing charge CHARGE Charges 52101 Commission COMM Commissions 52102 General Charge CHARGE Charges
The MI.CATEG.GROUPS of incoming records to the MI application are available for both the product category and the profit and loss category, being PROD.MI.CATEG.GRP and PAL.MI.CATEG.GRP.
Source File Product Category Group P & L Category Group

CATEG.ENTRY PROD.MI.CATEG.GRP PAL.MI.CATEG.GRP MI.ENTRY PROD.MI.CATEG.GRP PAL.MI.CATEG.GRP MI.AUTO.ENTRY PROD.MI.CATEG.GRP PAL.MI.CATEG.GRP BALANCE.MOVEMENT PROD.MI.CATEG.GRP Not available MI.BUDGET Not available Not available
Following our exapmple, this allows charges to be defined in an MI.SELECTION record which may look something like ;
1.GB DESCRIPTION All Charges 2.1 SELECTION.FIELD PAL.MI.CATEG.GROUP 3.1 OPERAND EQ 4.1.1 CRITERIA CHARGE
Records on this application can not be reversed.

desc.p: This is a language related field and is used to hold a short description of the group of categories which this record relates to.
Up to 20 alphanumeric characters. Mandatory Input.
This is a language related field and is used to describe the group of categories which this record relates to.
Up to 50 alphanumeric characters. Mandatory Input.
Identifies any additional element which has been defined locally to meet a particular requirement.

As in the majority of T24 Applications, the User is allowed to define in the MI.CATEG.GROUP file up to 999 Local Elements in addition to the standard fields previously specified. These Local Elements should be defined by the User where deemed necessary according to local practice.

Up to 35 characters as defined in the Local Table definition for this Local Reference field. Multivalue field. (Optional or Mandatory Input according to definition in LOCAL.TABLE for this Local Reference element)
This is the key to the records on this file and is a unique code used to group categoies to simplify the processing of entries with in the MI module.
Up to six alphanumeric characters. Mandatory Input.

This field is used to determine which rules will be checked (in addition to those specified on the CATEGORY record) during the MI.PL.ALLOCATION.2 processing for entries which fall into this category grouping.
Must be a valid record on the MI.PL.ALLOCATION.2 table.
